name: Elementwise equality of 2 number arrays
description: Returns TRUE value for every input number xk, that is equal to the corresponding second number yk, or FALSE value for all other pairs of numbers.

controls.caption: Result elements type
controls.name: elementType
controls.description: Usually you may specify "byte" to save memory, if FALSE/TRUE values are 0/1 or other little integers in 0..255 range.

controls.caption: TRUE value in the result
controls.name: trueValue
controls.description: Returned for equal number pairs. Usually 1.

controls.caption: FALSE value in the result
controls.description: Returned for non-equal number pairs. Usually 0.
controls.name: falseValue
invert
controls.caption: Invert behaviour
controls.description: If set, the results described above are inverted: value for TRUE is used for non-equal pairs, value for FALSE is used for equal pairs.

controls.caption: First X column
controls.description: First index of number in the blocks of the array X
controls.name: indexInBlockX

controls.caption: First Y column
controls.description: First index of number in the blocks of the array Y
controls.name: indexInBlockY

controls.caption: Number of processed columns
controls.description: Length of processed part in each block of both arrays; if 0, all arrays are processed and indexes above are ignored
controls.name: lengthInBlock
